pros: Good benefits. Pleasant people to work with.
Small town feel, friendly people in the community and some coworkers were great; like family. Some excellent Doctor, nurses and IDT.
cons: Needs an overhaul of the administration and "good ole boys & kiss ups" Could afford to spend more of their money on technology, equipment, and upgrades to facility; instead of the salaries for the ones at the top of the food chain. Has so much potential to grow and evolve but the same old mind set & people continue the same old stale, complacent behaviors. They should appreciate their employees that work hard not the ones that are there just for a check! For some reason, the harder you work the more people resent you and don't appreciate you. They have a user mindset. All about themselves and the numbers; total disregard for safety or burnout of staff.

pros: Great staff and awesome work enviorment
cons: The pay was on the little side.

pros: Providers are helpful and listen to concerns. They are great teachers. All support staff is awesome. ERTs..great. Lab to radiology and respiratory care and pharmacy we have a great team.
cons:
Short staffed. Travel nurses are awesome for short term.. but they are a bandaid ... And the problem needs sutures or staples. 
Short term fixes are awesome if the long term fix is planned or in action.

job_title: Insurance Coordinator in Newton Grove, NC
pros: get out now while you can
Staff members are very close & seek every opportunity to help eachother out. It is very much like a family.
cons: Disorganized environment, paid less for more work, high turnover rate, poor scheduling, staff not involved in decision making and leadership team very uninvolved, put people on call a lot and give the charge nurse patients of their own to save money, 1:12 CNA ratio & 1:6 nurse ratio. peds floor with only three nurses with PALS. leadership team will stick you just to save money. Staff do not feel valued and only stay due to locality and love for their staff members and patients.

review_title: It was a great learning experience.
pros: There is a hometown feel. Everyone is willing to help. Several nurses on staff have many many years of experience and are willing to share their knowledge with new nurses.
cons: Short staffed. Nurse to patient ratio is terrible and very unsafe for patients. Nurses can easily have 7 patients with a variety of different complex diagnosis.

pros: Their pay is competitive. They will work with you should you need a day off.
cons: Instead of keeping employment  within the community, they choose to employ people outside of the state

pros: They hired me in 2007 and i left in 2012
cons: Benefits sucked. Co-workers sucked. People accused other people of stealing money.

review_title: Great crew and organization to work for.
